title: Biden special envoy for hostages in Beirut in search of Austin Tice
description: Senior administration officials have no confirmed evidence that the imprisoned journalist is alive, but the State Department “will leave no stone unturned.”
author: Ellen Nakashima, Michael Birnbaum
excerpt: Senior administration officials have no confirmed evidence that the imprisoned journalist is alive, but the State Department “will leave no stone unturned.”
text: With Syria in the throes of the Assad regime collapse, the Biden administration is working to locate Austin Tice, an American freelance journalist abducted in Syria a dozen years ago.Though they have no concrete evidence that Tice is still alive, special envoy for hostages Roger Carstens has traveled to Beirut to coordinate efforts to find Tice, senior U.S. officials said.
html:
With Syria in the throes of the Assad regime collapse, the Biden administration is working to locate Austin Tice, an American freelance journalist abducted in Syria a dozen years ago.

Though they have no concrete evidence that Tice is still alive, special envoy for hostages Roger Carstens has traveled to Beirut to coordinate efforts to find Tice, senior U.S. officials said.
